story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: extreme_logistics
primary_trope.hook_text: Only a handful of races score 5/5 on Logistics. Trans Am Bike Race is one.
primary_trope.mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) — knowing a perfect score exists but not why triggers dopamine anticipation.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Trans Am Bike Race? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Trans Am Bike Race scored 90 out of 100. The Icons tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Trans Am Bike Race?

broll_sources.query: Trans Am Bike Race gravel race

beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Trans Am Bike Race. Astoria, Oregon to Yorktown, Virginia. 4233 mi. A 4.2 thousand+ mile expedition from Pacific to Atlantic following the historic TransAmerica Bicycle Trail. The route passes through 10 states, crossing the Continental Divide in Colorado and the Appalachian Mountains in Virginia. Surface is roughly 90% paved. quiet county roads, bike paths, and low-traffic highways. The character evolves dramatically: Pacific Northwest forests, Rocky Mountain passes, endless Kansas plains, Ozark rollercoasters, Ohio River farmland, and steep Appalachian ridges. This is America condensed into one transcontinental ride.
beats.text_on_screen: Trans Am Bike Race | Astoria, Oregon to Yorktown, Virginia | 4233 mi

broll_sources.query: Trans Am Bike Race route map
Trans Am Bike Race course walkthrough

beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Logistics. 5 out of 5. You could set your watch to this organization. Complete self-sufficiency across 4,233 miles with no outside support or pre-arranged aid. Length. 5 out of 5. This race measures commitment in hours, not miles. At 4,233 miles, the longest self-supported bike race on earth. Elevation. 5 out of 5. Mountainous. Your granny gear will earn its keep. 175,000 feet of climbing—equivalent to six Everest ascents from sea level. Climate. 5 out of 5. Mother Nature gets a vote and a veto. Every American climate zone compressed into one race. Adventure. 5 out of 5. Adventure is the entire point. Ocean-to-ocean traverse of the entire continental United States following Adventure Cycling's historic TransAmerica Trail. Prestige. 5 out of 5. The one people ask about first. Founded by ultra-endurance legend Mike Hall, who won the inaugural 2014 race and proclaimed: "Nothing that's worth anything is ever easy. Experience. 5 out of 5. Once-in-a-lifetime course experience. Mike Hall's philosophy—"Nothing that's worth anything is ever easy"—captures the transformative nature of 2-5 weeks crossing America. Community. 5 out of 5. Family reunion energy. Everyone belongs. Built on Adventure Cycling's 50-year TransAmerica Trail heritage and deep trail angel culture.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Field Depth. 5 out of 5. Deepest field in gravel. Murderer's row. Value. 5 out of 5. Exceptional value. Almost feels like a steal. Altitude. 4 out of 5. Thin air territory. Acclimatize or suffer. Race Quality. 4 out of 5. The kind of race that spoils you for others. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Standard gravel race budget. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Some chunky bits. Nothing catastrophic.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: Where Trans Am Bike Race earns its score.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment

broll_sources.query: Trans Am Bike Race finish line
Trans Am Bike Race race highlights

beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

strengths: The longest bike race distance on earth—4,200+ miles coast to coast
Complete American experience: 10 states, Pacific to Atlantic, every landscape
Rich trail angel culture and 50 years of TransAmerica Trail heritage
Accessible technically (90% paved) while remaining extreme in demands

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

weaknesses: 30-50% DNF rate reflects genuine brutality—2-5 weeks of continuous effort
Kansas wind and mental monotony has broken countless strong cyclists
Logistics for finish-to-start return travel are complex (coast to coast)
Sleep deprivation over 2-5 weeks compounds all physical challenges

beats.label: LOGISTICS

broll_sources.query: Astoria, Oregon to Yorktown, Virginia travel guide
Trans Am Bike Race race day

beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: PDX - 100mi to Astoria start; ORF or RIC - near Yorktown finish; DCA/IAD/BWI for D.C. finish option

Lodging: Astoria for pre-race. During race: city park camping is free and welcomed in Kansas/Missouri. Motels in most towns. Trail angels via Warm Showers app. Missoula has Adventure Cycling headquarters with cyclist amenities.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: The Coast-to-Coast Ultimate. Yes if you have serious ultra-endurance experience and can commit 2-5 weeks to crossing America. Yes if you can handle complete self-sufficiency across 4.2 thousand miles. Yes if you want the ultimate American cycling pilgrimage. Skip if you haven't completed multi-day self-supported events. Skip if 200+ mile days for weeks on end sounds impossible. Skip if Kansas wind and Appalachian rollercoasters would break your spirit.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Trans Am Bike Race isn't quite right for you. Tour Divide; Race Across America; Transcontinental Race; Colorado Trail Race
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Trans Am Bike Race? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.
